alert.note: Alert for Knox; Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 2:54AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Laurel and northwestern Knox Counties through 315 AM EDT... At 254 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over McHargue, or 9 miles south of London, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lesbas and Garrich around 300 AM EDT. Tuttle, Knoxfork and Jarvis around 305 AM EDT. Blackwater, Gibbs, Tedders, Cane Creek, Sasser, Fletcher, Cranes Nest, Lida, Marydell and Green Road around 310 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Sprule and Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
